definition: to roll up/to curl up/(of dust etc) to swirl up
variant of 捲起|卷起[juan3 qi3]
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Some go even further to beat the heat, rolling up their pants legs.
sentences.chinese: 有些人为了祛暑甚至过而无不及，竟卷起裤腿来。

sentences.english: Because of assailing Jiang Ling county, in the mistake, the evil plot, rolls up horse and foot.
sentences.chinese: 由于攻击在错误，邪恶计划中江陵，马和脚卷起。

sentences.english: By Noon the Sea went very high indeed.
sentences.chinese: 到了中午，大海卷起了狂澜。

sentences.english: Like the storm gods in the myths of Israel's neighbors, Yahweh heaps up the waters with a blast of wind.
sentences.chinese: 就像犹太人邻居的神话，耶和华用狂风卷起巨浪。

sentences.english: He started up the shore with the mast furled sail of his boat.
sentences.chinese: 他拿着桅竿和卷起的船帆，往岸上爬去。

sentences.english: The man tucked up his trousers for wading.
sentences.chinese: 那人卷起裤子，准备涉水。

sentences.english: I rolled up my sleevesand went back to Lulu.
sentences.chinese: 我卷起袖子，回到露露身边。

sentences.english: The bag is then unhooked or rolled up around the waist.
sentences.chinese: 这个袋子然后被解开或者卷起绕在腰部。

sentences.english: Beginning from the tucked in end, start making pleats in the Sari, about 5 inches deep.
sentences.chinese: 从年底的卷起，开始褶皱的玛丹萨里，约5英寸深。

sentences.english: He unstepped the mast and furled the sail and tied it.
sentences.chinese: 他拔下桅杆，把帆卷起，系住。

sentences.english: He backs off and removes a rolled piece of paper from his jumpsuit.
sentences.chinese: 他退后几步，从病号服中拿出一张卷起的纸。

sentences.english: It also recommends taking up carpets whenever possible or vacuuming them regularly with a high-filtration vacuum cleaner.
sentences.chinese: 同时，还建议尽量卷起地毯或者定期为地毯除尘。

sentences.english: The wind picked up Flappy and his umbrella. Flappy was happy.
sentences.chinese: 风卷起了飞行猪和他的雨伞，飞行猪很高兴。

sentences.english: He too would roll up his sleeves and scribble for money.
sentences.chinese: 他也卷起袖子，为钱乱写一通。

sentences.english: Bosses have to roll up their sleeves and work.
sentences.chinese: 老板得卷起袖管亲历亲为。

sentences.english: Definition: The control line that pulls the mainsail in or out.
sentences.chinese: 将主帆卷起或放开的控制索。

definition: to spin/to whirl around
gale/squall/whole gale (meteorology)
to wrap up/(fig.) to envelop/to swallow up
strong wind/gale
to raise one's head/to perk up
to separate/to disperse
to whistle/to scream/to whiz
whirlwind/tornado
to roll/to boil
wave
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
tornado/waterspout/twister
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
in Daoism, astral wind on which immortals may ride/strong wind
to brush/to caress (of breeze)/to praise
tornado/hurricane/twister/cyclone
